name: Develop Modern Apps Using Spring Ecosystem at BigData Era - Broadcasting
description:
Registration: https://goo.gl/Mma4xt.

Dear friends, we are happy to announce our next JUG UA meeting with an extended version of Oleg Tsal-Tsalko’s JavaDay Kyiv talk “Develop modern apps using Spring ecosystem at BigData era“

Description:
Spring is no longer just a framework, it’s huge ecosystem with lots of technologies in there. Nowadays Spring is a platform for developing all sorts of applications from simple REST services to distributed systems doing complex streams or batch processing with real-time analytics leveraging BigData.

In this talk Oleg will give an overview of what Spring offers you today, and how easy and cool is to develop Spring applications today using Spring Boot and Spring XD.

Spring Boot and Spring XD are designed to take away most of the burden and boilerplate code required to develop standard things again and again and make complex things look easy.

name: From CRUD to Hypermedia APIs with Spring (Streaming)
description:
Registration

From CRUD to Hypermedia APIs with Spring (by Vladimir Tsukur)


Typical way to design and expose HTTP API today is a so called CRUD approach: come up with URL templates for resources, map create-read-update-delete operations to HTTP verbs and serialize domain model as JSON. Nice and easy, isn’t it?

This talk will present limitations of CRUD style APIs and how to address them using “real” REST and hypermedia, HAL and ALPS. We’ll take a look how a set of libraries and tools from Spring helps building these APIs.

All the talking is not worth it without an example, so Spring-based application will be our guide. Amazon, PayPal, GitHub and other API providers have already started embracing hypermedia and linking by enhancing their HTTP interfaces. Are you next?

name: JUG Meetup: Hibernate & Multithreading talks (Streaming)
description:
Dear friends, we are happy to announce our next JUG UA Meetup, which you can join online via EPAM Youtube channel.


Date: April 20, 19:00 – 22:30

Registration is required: https://goo.gl/m9gG7F


Agenda


– Hibernate performance tuning (Igor Dmitriev)

Nowadays, almost every Enterprise application uses Hibernate and as we know, DB could be a bottleneck in the application. Furthermore incorrect uses of ORM frameworks can lead to performance problems.

In this talk we will cover the following things:

1. How to measure and increase performance
2. About different optimization techniques and effective practices
3. About pitfalls and bugs
4. Hibernate tuning techniques
5. How some Hibernate features work under the hood


The talk will be based on a speaker's own experience, and you'll see developers’ common mistakes.


– Multithreading in Java past & present (Yevgen Polukov)

In this talk Yevgen will give an overview of java.util.concurrent package and represent useful Java concurrency tools. We’ll cover the core functionality and the state-of-the-art API (Executors, Accumulators, StampedLock  etc).
In addition, we will see some ways of its implementation. As we know, the presentation has no worth without examples, so there will be some of them during the talk.

name: JavaDay Kharkiv 2016

venue.name: Premier Palace Hotel Kharkiv Conference Hall

description:
On Saturday, September, 17th we invite you to the JavaDay Kharkiv 2016conference which will take place in Premier Palace Hotel Kharkiv, the greatest Java- conference in Kharkiv. The participants of the event will hear over 14 speeches from the leading Ukrainian and international experts.

JavaDay conferences have been held in Ukraine for 6 years at an end. In Kharkiv it is conducted for the second year. This year, in June, the conference took place in Lviv. The participants got the bright ideas, heard about new features in Java-development and received positive emotions at JavaDay Lviv 2016

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fEHQHava29Q


Who are our speakers at JavaDay Kharkiv 2016

Nikolay Alimenkov, Senior Delivery Managerта Java Tech Lead@EPAM, experienced trainer

Nikolay – is expert in Java applications development and team management. Having more than 12 years experience in development he specializes in the complex spread of the scoping systems.

He is an active participant and speaker at many international conferences. The founder of XP Injection training center. Organizer and founder of Selenium Camp JEEConf, XP Days Ukraine and IT Brunch conferences.

Nicolas Frankel, Senior Consultant @SAP Hybris
Nicolas — software architect with 15 years of experience in consulting for many different clients in various directions such as telecommunications, banking, insurance, retail trade etc. Usually works for Java/ Java EE і Spring technologies, specializing in quality control, process building and Rich Internet Applications.

Oleg Zal-Zalko, Lead Software Engineer @EPAM

Speaker and active participant Kiev JUG. Participant of many study initiatives and JCP/AdoptJSR programs.

Takes part in different educational initiatives and JCP/AdoptJSR programs. Avid developer. Always looking for opportunities to learn something new from other professionals. Eagerly shares his knowledge.

Boris Trofimov, Solution Architect @Sigma Software

The founder of Odessa JUG. With about 10 years  of professional software development Boris has a broad experience of developing mobile application and work in big data projects. Avid follower of scalable architecture.


See other speakers JavaDay Kharkiv.

Apart from the unique program and experts with whom you will have an opportunity to speak you will enjoy different entertainment and surprises;

GET A TICKET FOT THE CONFERENCE

Why should you visit the conference?

#1: discover better and newer methods for working with Java
#2: meet leading international and ukrainian experts in Java development.

#3: conference will help to find new ways to resolve problems in software development

#4: communicate with supporters of the same opinions

name: JUG UA meeting with Java EE experts
description:
Dear friends, we are happy to announce our next JUG UA meeting (just before

JavaDay Kyiv) with world well-known experts at Java EE platform Reza Rahman and Ivar Grimstad.

Date: October 13, 18:40 – 21:00
Venue: EPAM Systems, Kudryashova 14B (Cafeteria)

Registration is required.

You can also join this event online.

Agenda:

Java EE past and futureJava EE 8 RoadmapMicroProfile.ioQ/A session

Speakers:

Reza Rahman – former Oracle Java EE Evangelist and JCP Expert. Reza has 10+ years of experience with technology leadership, enterprise architecture, application development and consulting. Has been working with Java EE technology since its inception, developing on almost every major application platform ranging from Tomcat to JBoss, GlassFish, WebSphere and WebLogic.

He is the author of the popular book EJB 3 in Action.

Ivar Grimstad is a Java Champion and software architect focusing on Enterprise Java. Participates in the Java Community Process as a member of the Expert Groups for JSR 368 (JMS 2.1), JSR 371 (MVC 1.0), JSR 375 (Java EE Security API). He is a member of the NetBeans Dream Team. Has been working with Java since the beginning and tried out everything from lightweight mobile applications to large scale enterprise applications.

name: Kyiv JUG Meetup: GWT & Angular / Get Reactive with Spring 5
description:
Just one month after JavaDay20

16 in Kyiv, we are happy to announce the next Kyiv JUG Meetup: GWT & Angular / Get Reactive with Spring 5.

Registration is required.

Agenda:

GWT & Angular: Relatives or Foes

(Eugene Kotsiubynsky, Software Engineer @GlobalLogic)

– What are GWT and Angular
– Why these tools appeared
– What do they

have in common
– Who rules
– The future of GWT or “Is GWT dead?”

Get Reactive with Spring 5

(Oleh Dokuka, Software Engineer @Levi9)

5 Spring – the tool that is over 13 years pleases our hearts and eyes of customers. Despite this long history of development the project continues to follow the latest trends and provides to developers the awesome set of add-ons that simplify the daily life.
During this tech-talk, I would like to discuss delicacies which were cooked by developers from Pivotal and how Reactivity reflected on the 5th iteration of the framework.

Register by the link to be able to join.

name: Make Your Java Object-Oriented, 64 Practical Steps
description:
On December 20th, Yegor Bugayenko - a top-speaker at lots of international conferences and the author of two books will come to Kyiv for a specially organized UA DEV ClUB meeting with his “Make Your Java Object-Oriented, 64 Practical Steps” talk.

You can either get a ticket (details and tickets by the link https://epa.ms/uadevclub-attend), or join the streaming for free https://epa.ms/uadevclub-streaming.

In this almost 3-hours seminar Yegor will summarize all practical recommendations he can give a practical #Java-engineer who wants to make his/her code more object-oriented.

We’ll go through the real code of our open-source and commercial projects to demonstrate most typical mistakes programmers keep making in Java. There will be no theoretical and abstract ideas, just practical recommendations with Yegor's reasoning behind them.

Should you have any questions, please contact Kateryna:
kateryna_golovinova@epam,com, 067-417-74-85.

name: Kyiv JUG Meetup: Clean Tests / JDK changes
description:
When: February 23, 6.30 p.m - 10.30 p.m


Where: Kyiv, Uritskogo street 3 (Olympic Hall) & online via EPAM YouTube channel

Price: free after registration (limited number of seats)

Speakers:

Noam Almog, Tech Lead @Wix

Topic: “An Obsessive Compulsive Guide To Clean Tests”

TDD isn’t news, and most everyone agrees that writing tests (before, during or after implementation) is valuable. Hardly anyone agrees on what good, clean tests look like, though; if your tests are a live specification of your codebase, don’t they deserve the same care and attention as your production code?

This talk focuses on how to keep your tests readable, simple and maintainable. Specifically we will discuss how the “given-when-then” pattern affects the way you factor your code, and showcase the remarkable differences between a sloppy specification and a well-factored one.

Moderate experience with testing is expected; knowledge Scala might be helpful but is not required.

Igor Dmitriev, Software Engineer @Very Good Group

Topic: “JDK changes behind the scenes”

We have been using Java 7 and 8 for a long time. There are many new features, like Stream API, Lambdas, Optional, New Data/Time API, Default methods, etc. At the same time, there are so many small improvements as well, which go without attracting attention. Many developers do not even know about those changes. Therefore, we are going to change this.

Schedule:

18:30 — 19:00 Registration
19:00 — 20:30 Noam Almog “An Obsessive Compulsive Guide To Clean Tests”
20:30 — 21:00 Break
21:00 — 22:30 Igor Dmitriev “JDK changes behind the scenes”

More details on speakers and talks can be found here</a>. You need to register to be able to:

We all know what puzzlers are - the speaker presents a problem and the audience has to solve it, and we move on to the next problem. name: Kharkiv JUG Meetup #4
description:
You need to register by the link to be able to attend this event.

When: March 23, 18.30 -21.00

Where: Kharkiv, Blagoveshchenskaya str., Fabrika Space

Language: Russian

Price: free after registration


Speakers:

Yevhen Mospan, Solution Architect @EPAM

Topic: “Non-blocking programming in Java. Introduction to Netty”

This topic will cover the capabilities of non-blocking programming in Java. We will try to understand when non-blocking programming makes sense for you, and when old blocking world is still good to use. During this talk, we will talk a bit about non-blocking features in popular web and application servers. In addition, we will dedicate some time to understanding basics and purpose of asynchronous framework Netty.

About speaker: Yevhen has been in IT for 12+ years. Currently he holds the position of an expert in EPAM Java Competence Center, and is assigned as a Solution Architect to production projects. Yevhen has been involved into different projects in many business domains such as insurance, e-commerce, billing and logistics; has passion for following modern Java trends for building scalable, robust, highly available applications with focus on effective architecture.

Maksym Bruner, Solution Architect @EPAM

Topic: Using SonarQube as a code quality booster

This topic will cover typical Sonar use cases:

- how to start using it;

- how to include sonar checks into build pipeline;

- how to work with sonar rules sets, etc.

Also, it will cover cases when you want to introduce Sonar in the middle or even at the end of your project.

About speaker: 8+ years in production software development (almost 5 years with EPAM), now working in Java CC. Maksym participated in various kinds of projects including large legacy ones and those built from scratch using modern technologies, heavy monolithic applications and distributed systems designed with SOA principles . Technologist by heart he thinks it is highly important to promote advanced technologies and modern practices that will help us build software easily and with high quality.

Schedule: 18:30 — 19:00 Registration
19:00 — 19:45 Yevhen Mospan “Non-blocking programming in Java. Introduction to Netty”
19:45 — 20:15 Break
20:15 — 21:00 Maksym Bruner, "Using SonarQube as a code quality booster"

Should you have any questions, please contact Kateryna Golovinova:
email: kateryna_golovinova@epam.com

You need to register to be able to attend this event.

Registration.

name: Kyiv JUG Meetup: JUnit 5 / Project Reactor
description:
When: 13 April (Thursday)
Time: 18:30
Place: Kyiv, Uritskogo street 3 (Olympic Hall) & online via EPAM YouTube channel
Price: free after registration (online streaming is available as well)

Speakers:
Yaroslav Yermilov, @EPAM Ukraine
Topic: “JUnit 5: The Rise of Jupiter”


The planet Jupiter (5th! in the Solar System) needs 11 years to make one complete orbit around the Sun. So do JUnit needs 11 years to get a new major release, which means it’s going to be really huge. Milestone 3 is already available and GA is scheduled on Q3 2017, so now it’s the best time to learn and discuss how automating testing is going to look like very soon. In this talk we will go through JUnit 5 changes and see how they will influence test code we write. Also we will discuss JUnit 5 architectural approach, how it can be extended and how it turns JUnit from test framework into test platform.

Oleh Dokuka, @Levi 9
Topic: “Project Reactor”

During the meetup, we are going to overview Project Reactor in depth and will try to understand how to use correctly given functionality and to rebuild imperative web application to reactive one:

1. Project Reactor overview.
2. Imperative Application analyzing (2 pages web application with the Gitter integration and plain DB for event logging)
3. Test Refactoring
4. Application refactoring.


Schedule:
18:30 – 19:00 Registration
19:00 – 20:20 JUnit 5: The Rise of Jupiter (Yaroslav Yermilov)
20:20 – 20:40 Break
20:40 – 22:30 Project Reactor (Oleh Dokuka)


More details on speakers and talks can be found here. You need to register to be able to:

• or join online.

name: Dnipro JUG UA meetup #1 | 27th of April
description:
When: April 27th, 18.00 -22.00.

Where: Dnipro, 37 Chernyshevskogo street (Coworking Hub)

Price: free after registration.

Speakers: 

Andriy Trubitsyn, Solution Architect @EPAM

Topic: “Continuous Integration for Microservices with Jenkins 2.0, Docker and Kubernetes”

What is necessary for CI for microservices? Jenkins 2.0 with pipelines looks like a good option for that. But is it enough? Let’s add Docker for containerization. We think it could be even better with Kubernetes. The presentation will provide you how to build CI for microservices from scratch with those tools and describes some best practices applicable for Microservices CI.

About speaker: Andriy Trubitsyn is a hands-on architect passioned for microservices architecture style, who spent a lot of nights researching the topic. A person who drives a microservices accelerator in EPAM and consults about different aspects of microservices-related things.

Roman Shramkov, Solution Architect @EPAM

Topic: “Solution Architecture, touching the base”

In this talk Roman will explain such interesting role as a Solution Architect and his place in big and technically complex projects. We will discuss what it takes to be a good Solution Architect and how to start in this discipline.

About speaker: Roman is in IT for more than 12 years and at least for 10 years he builds enterprise java applications in different business domains. His area of interest is pragmatic development and engineering practices which help to build excellent systems with real developers and for real customers. Roman gladly participates in different IT events and likes to exchange experience with other people, although still likes writing code more than talking about it.

Yevgen Mospan, Solution Architect @EPAM

Topic: “Micro services on top of Netflix OSS”

Nowadays more and more companies all of over the world want to build flexible platform for their IT Services. Micro services can be on of the most important architectural trend for future decade in this area. Learning and understanding of useful components for such approach can give great benefits for IT people, who want to be on the crest of the wave. Netflix components can be first step into modern world of micro services architecture.

About speaker: Yevhen has been in IT for 12+ years. Currently he holds the position of an expert in EPAM Java Competence Center, and is assigned as a Solution Architect to production projects. Yevhen has been involved into different projects in many business domains such as insurance, e-commerce, billing and logistics; has passion for following modern Java trends for building scalable, robust, highly available applications with focus on effective architecture. 

 Schedule:

18:00 – 18:30 Registration

18:30 – 19:30 Andriy Trubitsyn "Continuous Integration for Microservices with Jenkins 2.0, Docker and Kubernetes"

19:30 – 20:30 Roman Shramkov "Solution Architecture, touching the base"

20:30 – 20:50 Break

20:50 – 21:50 Yevgen Mospan "Micro services on top of Netflix OSS"

Should you have any questions, please email <a>kateryna_golovinova@epam.com</a>.

More details on this event. You need to register to be able to attend this event.

Registration.

name: Kyiv JUG UA meetup: Bytecode Instrumentation / Spring Cloud
description:
We are happy to announce our next Kyiv JUG UA meeting. Our partner EPAM provides everyone with a possibility to join this event online.

Date: May 25, 19:00 – 22:00 (registration from 18:30)
Venue: “Olympic Hall – Vokzalnaya”, Vasylia Lypkivskoho St, 3, Kyiv


Registration

Agenda:

How and why to instrument Bytecode in Java apps?

(Anton Arhipov, Developer Advocate @ ZeroTurnaround, Java Champion)


Microservices Architecture with Spring Cloud


(Orkhan Gasimov, @Nextiva)

Microservices architecture is a hot topic flying around distributed application development nowadays. There are many tech-stacks bringing in development power to build distributed applications. We will review core concepts of microservice architectures and will see implementation examples using core components from Spring Cloud which is a mature Java framework built on Spring Boot providing set of tools for building distributed applications with microservice approaches out of the box.
